types.name: Mutation
types.description: The schemaâ€™s entry-point for mutations. This acts as the public, top-level API from which all mutation queries must start.

types.name: Actor
types.description: A Partner organization or shop.

fields.name: avatarUrl
fields.description: A URL referencing the avatar associated with the actor.

fields.name: id
fields.description: A globally unique identifier for the actor. Example value: `gid://partners/Shop/1234`.

fields.name: name
fields.description: The name of the actor. This might be a Partner organization or shop name.

types.name: ApiVersion
types.description: A version of the API.

fields.name: displayName
fields.description: The human-readable name of the version.

fields.name: handle
fields.description: The unique identifier of an ApiVersion. All supported API versions have a date-based (YYYY-MM) or `unstable` handle.

fields.name: supported
fields.description: Whether the version is supported by Shopify.

types.name: App
types.description: A Shopify [app](/concepts/apps).

fields.name: apiKey
fields.description: A unique application API identifier.

fields.name: events
fields.description: A list of app events.

args.name: after
args.description: Returns the elements in the list that come after the specified cursor.

args.name: before
args.description: Returns the elements in the list that come before the specified cursor.

args.name: first
args.description: Returns the first _n_ elements from the list.

args.name: last
args.description: Returns the last _n_ elements from the list.

args.name: types
args.description: Returns app events of the specified types.

args.name: shopId
args.description: Returns app events associated with the specified shop ID. Example value: `gid://partners/Shop/1234`.

args.name: chargeId
args.description: Returns app events associated with the specified [app charge](/tutorials/bill-for-your-app-using-graphql-admin-api). Example value: `gid://shopify/AppUsageRecord/1234`.

args.name: occurredAtMin
args.description: Returns app events that occurred on or after the specified date and time.

args.name: occurredAtMax
args.description: Returns app events that occurred on or before the specified date and time.

fields.name: id
fields.description: The ID of the app. Example value: `gid://partners/App/1234`.

fields.name: name
fields.description: The name of the app.

types.name: AppCharge
types.description: A [charge](/docs/admin-api/rest/reference/billing/applicationcharge) created through an app.

fields.name: amount
fields.description: The amount of the app charge.

fields.name: id
fields.description: A globally unique identifier.

fields.name: name
fields.description: The name of the app charge.

fields.name: test
fields.description: Whether the app purchase was a test transaction.

types.name: AppCredit
types.description:
A [credit](/docs/admin-api/rest/reference/billing/applicationcredit) issued
to a merchant for an app. Merchants are entitled to app credits under certain circumstances,
such as when a paid app subscription is downgraded partway through its billing cycle.

fields.name: amount
fields.description: The amount that can be used towards future app purchases in Shopify.

fields.name: id
fields.description: A globally unique identifier.

fields.name: name
fields.description: The description of the app credit.

fields.name: test
fields.description: Whether the app credit was a test transaction.

types.name: AppCreditEvent
types.description: An event involving an app credit.

fields.name: appCredit
fields.description:
A [credit](/docs/admin-api/rest/reference/billing/applicationcredit) issued
to a merchant for an app. Merchants are entitled to app credits under certain circumstances,
such as when a paid app subscription is downgraded partway through its billing cycle.

types.name: AppOneTimeSale
types.description: A transaction corresponding to a one-time app charge.

fields.name: app
fields.description: The app associated with the sale.

fields.name: chargeId
fields.description: The ID of the [app charge](/tutorials/bill-for-your-app-using-graphql-admin-api) associated with the transaction. Example value: `gid://shopify/AppUsageRecord/1234`. This value might be `null` for transactions that occurred before September 2020.

fields.name: createdAt
fields.description: The date and time when the transaction was recorded.

fields.name: grossAmount
fields.description: The total amount that the merchant paid, excluding taxes.

fields.name: id
fields.description: The transaction ID.

fields.name: netAmount
fields.description: The net amount that is added to or deducted from your payout.

fields.name: shop
fields.description: The shop associated with the transaction.

fields.name: shopifyFee
fields.description: The amount that Shopify retained from the sale.

types.name: AppPricingInterval
types.description: The billing frequency for the app.

enumValues.name: EVERY_30_DAYS
enumValues.description: The merchant is billed for this app every 30 days.

enumValues.name: ANNUAL
enumValues.description: The merchant is billed for this app annually.

types.name: AppPurchaseOneTime
types.description:
A one-time app charge for services and features purchased once by a store.
For example, a one-time migration of a merchant's data from one platform to another.

fields.name: id

fields.name: name
fields.description: The name of the app charge.

fields.name: test
fields.description: Whether the app purchase was a test transaction.

fields.description:
A one-time app charge for services and features purchased once by a store.

types.name: Currency
types.description: Supported monetary currencies from ISO 4217.

types.name: DateTime
types.description: An [ISO-8601](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/ISO_8601) encoded UTC date time string. Example value: `"2019-07-03T20:47:55.123456Z"`.

types.name: Decimal
types.description: A signed decimal number, which supports arbitrary precision and is serialized as a string.

types.name: ID
types.description: Represents a unique identifier that is Base64 obfuscated. It is often used to refetch an object or as key for a cache. The ID type appears in a JSON response as a String; however, it is not intended to be human-readable. When expected as an input type, any string (such as `"VXNlci0xMA=="`) or integer (such as `4`) input value will be accepted as an ID.

types.name: Int
types.description: Represents non-fractional signed whole numeric values. Int can represent values between -(2^31) and 2^31 - 1.

types.name: Job
types.description: An [Experts Marketplace job](https://help.shopify.com/partners/selling-services).

fields.name: confirmedCompleted
fields.description: Whether the merchant has marked the job as complete.

fields.name: conversation
fields.description: The conversation containing messages exchanged with the merchant.

fields.name: createdAt
fields.description: The date and time the job was submitted to your organization.

fields.name: dashboardUrl
fields.description: A URL to access this job in the Partner Dashboard.

fields.name: id
fields.description: A globally unique identifier.

fields.name: lastEventAt
fields.description: The date and time of the most recent job event.

fields.name: requirements
fields.description: The job requirements that the merchant provided.

fields.name: services
fields.description: The services requested for this job.

fields.name: shop
fields.description: The shop that submitted the job.

fields.name: status
fields.description: The status of the job.

fields.name: edges
fields.description: A list of edges.

fields.name: pageInfo
fields.description: Information about pagination in a connection.

types.name: JobEdge
types.description: An edge in a connection.

fields.name: cursor
fields.description: A cursor for use in pagination.

fields.name: node
fields.description: The item at the end of the edge.

types.name: JobRequirement
types.description: Details that the merchant provided about their job requirements. Details are returned as sets of questions and responses.

fields.name: question
fields.description: The question that the merchant was asked about their job or store.

fields.name: responses
fields.description: The merchant's responses to the question.

types.name: JobStatus
types.description: The status of the [Experts Marketplace job](https://help.shopify.com/partners/selling-services).

enumValues.name: NEW
enumValues.description: The job has been submitted to your organization, but hasn't been opened.

enumValues.name: OPENED
enumValues.description: The job has been viewed by your organization.

enumValues.name: RESPONDED
enumValues.description: The job has been responded to by your organization.

enumValues.name: AWAITING_RESPONSE
enumValues.description: The merchant has taken an action that requires attention from your organization.

enumValues.name: COMPLETED
enumValues.description: The job has been marked as complete by your organization.

enumValues.name: DECLINED
enumValues.description: The job has been declined by the merchant or your organization.

enumValues.name: CLOSED
enumValues.description: The job has been closed by the merchant.

enumValues.name: EXPIRED
enumValues.description: The job has expired. A job expires when your organization does not send an initial response to a job within 72 hours.

enumValues.name: INACTIVE
enumValues.description: The job has been marked inactive by your organization.

types.name: TaxTransaction
types.description:
Tax transactions are not computed for pending transactions. Instead, they're rolled
up as one transaction per payout. The type of tax and the way it's
computed is dependent on the type of transaction.

For sale transactions, such as app subscriptions or theme purchases, Shopify charges
the Partner tax on the fee collected for brokering the transaction. The amount is
a negative number in this scenario.

For referral transactions, such as a development store transfer, Shopify pays the Partner
a commission. The tax represents any taxes on the referral commission that are payable to
the Partner. The amount is a positive number in this scenario.

fields.name: amount
fields.description: The net amount that is added to or deducted from your payout.

fields.name: createdAt
fields.description: The date and time when the transaction was recorded.

fields.name: id
fields.description: The transaction ID.

fields.name: type
fields.description: The tax model applied to the transaction, based on the transaction type.

types.name: TaxTransactionType
types.description: The tax model applied to the transaction, based on the transaction type.

enumValues.description: The taxes charged on Shopifyâ€™s commission fee for an app, theme, or service transaction.

enumValues.name: REFERRAL_COMMISSION
enumValues.description: The taxes paid out on your commission fee for a referral.

enumValues.name: TAX
enumValues.description:
Tax transactions are not computed for pending transactions. Instead, they're rolled
up as one transaction per payout. The type of tax and the way it's
computed is dependent on the type of transaction.

For sale transactions, such as app subscriptions or theme purchases, Shopify charges
the Partner tax on the fee collected for brokering the transaction. The amount is
a negative number in this scenario.

For referral transactions, such as a development store transfer, Shopify pays the Partner
a commission. The tax represents any taxes on the referral commission that are payable to
the Partner. The amount is a positive number in this scenario.

types.name: __Directive
types.description:
A Directive provides a way to describe alternate runtime execution and type validation behavior in a GraphQL document.

In some cases, you need to provide options to alter GraphQL's execution behavior in ways field arguments will not suffice, such as conditionally including or skipping a field. Directives provide this by describing additional information to the executor.

types.name: __DirectiveLocation
types.description: A Directive can be adjacent to many parts of the GraphQL language, a __DirectiveLocation describes one such possible adjacencies.

enumValues.name: QUERY
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a query operation.

enumValues.name: MUTATION
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a mutation operation.

enumValues.name: SUBSCRIPTION
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a subscription operation.

enumValues.name: FIELD
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a field.

enumValues.name: FRAGMENT_DEFINITION
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a fragment definition.

enumValues.name: FRAGMENT_SPREAD
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a fragment spread.

enumValues.name: INLINE_FRAGMENT
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to an inline fragment.

enumValues.name: SCHEMA
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a schema definition.

enumValues.name: SCALAR
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a scalar definition.

enumValues.name: OBJECT
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to an object type definition.

enumValues.name: FIELD_DEFINITION
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a field definition.

enumValues.name: ARGUMENT_DEFINITION
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to an argument definition.

enumValues.name: INTERFACE
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to an interface definition.

enumValues.name: UNION
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a union definition.

enumValues.name: ENUM
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to an enum definition.

enumValues.name: ENUM_VALUE
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to an enum value definition.

enumValues.name: INPUT_OBJECT
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to an input object type definition.

enumValues.name: INPUT_FIELD_DEFINITION
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to an input object field definition.

types.name: __EnumValue
types.description: One possible value for a given Enum. Enum values are unique values, not a placeholder for a string or numeric value. However an Enum value is returned in a JSON response as a string.

types.name: __Field
types.description: Object and Interface types are described by a list of Fields, each of which has a name, potentially a list of arguments, and a return type.

types.name: __InputValue
types.description: Arguments provided to Fields or Directives and the input fields of an InputObject are represented as Input Values which describe their type and optionally a default value.

fields.name: defaultValue
fields.description: A GraphQL-formatted string representing the default value for this input value.

types.name: __Schema
types.description: A GraphQL Schema defines the capabilities of a GraphQL server. It exposes all available types and directives on the server, as well as the entry points for query, mutation, and subscription operations.

fields.name: directives
fields.description: A list of all directives supported by this server.

fields.name: mutationType
fields.description: If this server supports mutation, the type that mutation operations will be rooted at.

fields.name: queryType
fields.description: The type that query operations will be rooted at.

fields.name: subscriptionType
fields.description: If this server support subscription, the type that subscription operations will be rooted at.

fields.name: types
fields.description: A list of all types supported by this server.

types.name: __Type
types.description:
The fundamental unit of any GraphQL Schema is the type. There are many kinds of types in GraphQL as represented by the `__TypeKind` enum.

Depending on the kind of a type, certain fields describe information about that type. Scalar types provide no information beyond a name and description, while Enum types provide their values. Object and Interface types provide the fields they describe. Abstract types, Union and Interface, provide the Object types possible at runtime. List and NonNull types compose other types.

types.name: __TypeKind
types.description: An enum describing what kind of type a given `__Type` is.

enumValues.name: SCALAR
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is a scalar.

enumValues.name: OBJECT
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is an object. `fields` and `interfaces` are valid fields.

enumValues.name: INTERFACE
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is an interface. `fields` and `possibleTypes` are valid fields.

enumValues.name: UNION
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is a union. `possibleTypes` is a valid field.

enumValues.name: ENUM
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is an enum. `enumValues` is a valid field.

enumValues.name: INPUT_OBJECT
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is an input object. `inputFields` is a valid field.

enumValues.name: LIST
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is a list. `ofType` is a valid field.

enumValues.name: NON_NULL
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is a non-null. `ofType` is a valid field.

directives.name: include
directives.description: Directs the executor to include this field or fragment only when the `if` argument is true.

args.name: if
args.description: Included when true.

directives.name: skip
directives.description: Directs the executor to skip this field or fragment when the `if` argument is true.

args.name: if
args.description: Skipped when true.

directives.name: deprecated
directives.description: Marks an element of a GraphQL schema as no longer supported.

args.name: reason
args.description: Explains why this element was deprecated, usually also including a suggestion for how to access supported similar data. Formatted in [Markdown](https://daringfireball.net/projects/markdown/).
